title: Wells to Glastonbury Walk Route

images.title: Tom Pennington / Wells Cathedral
images.caption: Wells Cathedral - start point for the walk

images.title: Pam Brophy / Remains of Glastonbury Abbey: Glastonbury
images.caption: Remains of Glastonbury Abbey: Glastonbury. King Arthur and Guinevere are ostensibly buried here. This square is a mixture of the remains of the Abbey in the north western section, farmland and built up area in the rest.

description: This walk takes you from the Somerset city of Wells to Glastonbury Tor. The route uses a mixture of waymarked footpaths and quiet country lanes to take you through the countryside between the two settlements. It runs for a distance of about 8 miles along flat paths before a small climb at the end. The walk starts at the historic Wells Cathedral where you can pick up the Monarch's Way and follow it south towards Launcherley. You then head west along the Long Drove before turning south to head through the countryside at the western outskirts of Glastonbury. The route then heads east through the town passing the fascinating Glastonbury Abbey before climbing to the famous hill for great views over the area.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: At the end of the walk you can enjoy refreshments at the Rifleman's Armsin Glastonbury. It's just a short downhill stroll from the Tor and within a stone's throw of the Chalice Well Gardens. The pub has a nice beer garden with views towards the tor. You can find it at 4 Chilkwell St with a postcode of BA6 8DB for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walk you can pick up the Glastonbury Canal and enjoy an easy waterside stroll. In Wells the East Mendip Way explores a beautiful section of the Mendip Hills.

display_address: Wells, Somerset, England, BA5 2RB, United Kingdom
